text: Hey, of course you can't include any reliance on HubDB, serverless functions, membership app, custom objects, etc for Marketplace to begin with. To be clear for starter, do not use any CTA or video fields. While the theme would still be listed, a warning would show on the listing for Starter or Free CMS users. Also, do not use a HubSpot Payments module or any connection to the meetings scheduler. Essentially, just make sure the theme is pretty "bare bones", using core elements only.
Thanks <@U0397BZRK6G> for the detailed answer. I found out that CTA and Video fields are culprit here. I will have to give the choice to the user to have a CTA or URL field.
No problem. Yes, giving that choice is good, but as long as the CTA field still exists in the module, your theme will still give that alert.... although the theme will still be available and usable.
